posts.post_content: This, for the uninitiated, is Kamigawa in a nutshell. Unique effects, some colour-pie-bending, and excessive costs as far as the eye can see. Absolutely soaked in flavour, too.

welcome to a world of [dustbowl](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=dustbowl) and [flagstones of trokair](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=flagstones of trokair) , a world were your opponent gets lands and you do not a world were every turn they play a legendary land sac it to destroy your land and then get to return their land to their hand. also see [dark depths](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=dark depths).

posts.post_content: Just so you know, the Kenzo mentioned in Yomiji's flavor text is the white flip card Bushi Tenderfoot. Once he flips he becomes Kenzo. Apparently the flavor text is talking about how he survived and returned as a legend (flip), albeit tragic.

Posted By: Dark_Raider (12/7/2010 8:07:23 AM)

posts.post_content:
I kinda agree, at this cost this guy won't find much use. You don't really want a big body, there are better option out there, you want his ability. But for seven mana? C'mon, this effect isn't seriously exploitable anywhere, you'll have a hard time building a deck with many legendary permanents that synergizes nicely.  
  
This would be more playable if it returned the cards back to play at the end of turn (possibly for a slight cost), it would make the card even powerful. But like that? No, thanks...
posts.html:
I kinda agree, at this cost this guy won't find much use. You don't really want a big body, there are better option out there, you want his ability. But for seven mana? C'mon, this effect isn't seriously exploitable anywhere, you'll have a hard time building a deck with many legendary permanents that synergizes nicely.

This would be more playable if it returned the cards back to play at the end of turn (possibly for a slight cost), it would make the card even powerful. But like that? No, thanks...

Posted By: redcap04 (12/27/2009 1:28:54 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I run this in a deck with the ten dragons from the Planar Chaos set. Any one of them enchanted with [Bear Umbra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bear Umbra) means I can drop up to 2 a turn. And this guy lets me bring them back.   
EDIT: He's no longer in the deck. That was in January 2011. Just for fun I started to build a commander deck around him. I changed my mind. It's now a [Captain Sisay](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Captain Sisay) commander deck that combos this guy with [Saffi](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Saffi). Plus the addition of green means more ramp. Maybe  [Perilous Forrays](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Perilous Forrays) and a one-drop legend like [Rhys the Redeemed](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rhys the Redeemed)?
posts.html:
I run this in a deck with the ten dragons from the Planar Chaos set. Any one of them enchanted with Bear Umbra means I can drop up to 2 a turn. And this guy lets me bring them back.
EDIT: He's no longer in the deck. That was in January 2011. Just for fun I started to build a commander deck around him. I changed my mind. It's now a Captain Sisay commander deck that combos this guy with Saffi. Plus the addition of green means more ramp. Maybe Perilous Forrays and a one-drop legend like Rhys the Redeemed?
